Public Remarks: Classic Nantucket Historical Beach house built in 1923 offered for 1st time since 1965. The first permanent residence in West Bay, was first occupied by George & Donna Hewitt of the George H. Hewitt Rubber Stamp Company which is still in operation today. It's hard to imagine a more picturesque setting with beach access directly across the street, stunning close-in ocean and city views located on one of West Vancouver's most prestigious streets. Designated as a building of primary historical importance, this 4 bedroom home has been meticulously maintained including an entirely new foundation to preserve the unique and historic integrity of a time in West Vancouver known for summer cottages, ferry transportation, logging and early pioneer settlements.
